website_summaries.verdict: The best value for your money. A remarkable machine from a company with a great reputation.
pros: Produces very rich colors thanks to five ink cartridges
A bonus feature that might also save you money
cons: There's a noticeable delay between initializing printing and when paper starts to come out of the machine

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down!
customer_reviews.text: My MX922 just died without warning. Printed fine one day then it threw a B200 error the next. I tried cleaning the print heads with warm water and unplugging the machine for 5 five minutes as instructed by tech support. When that didn’t work I was told that I would need to ship, or deliver the printer to a service facility and pay them to troubleshoot it. Also, I was informed that the B200 error is a generic hardware error that locks up the whole machine so scanning, faxing, making PDFs... etc, all are not accessible until the error is fixed. Apparently this is a common error for all Canon printers.
customer_reviews.author: R. Leon

customer_reviews.title: Four stars???
customer_reviews.text: Run do not walk away from this one. Horrible experience. Wireless worked for about a minute and a half and it died completely and mysteriously 14 months later. The printer ink is crazy expensive because you need five different inks and it seems to go through ink crazy fast on normal printing. If you look on the canon website it has horrible reviews and similar complaints with only 2 and 1/2 stars out of five. Still can't fathom how this printer got 4 stars on Amazon. So grumpy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: chloegirl

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, but short life
customer_reviews.text: There are many things to love about this printer. Fast. Good print quality. Easy scanner access. The best wireless support I've ever seen in a printer. Support for Google Cloud Print. Templates, etc. However, I have had this printer for 20 months (bought in March 2013), and now its alignment is faulty. Text is blurry, and all black is printed "double-struck", exactly as shown in this forum discussion:  . I worked with Canon technical support, and they say that the printer has to be serviced or replaced. Yeah, that's exactly what I need as I try to print my family Christmas letter. What is it about inkjet printers such that they die about every two years?
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: this product is bad but there support is worse
customer_reviews.text: Worthless. Received, unpacked, and turned on. Error code 6000 appeared on screen and that was as far as I got. From posts on Cannon site, this is a problem with this model. (Wish I had read their posts before I bought.) Cannon support is non existant. Support said If the warranty was still in effect, (I had it less than 24 hrs.) maybe they would take a return and issue me a reconditioned model. If I opted to have it picked up at my home I would hae to pay extra. I advise not buying Canon, this product is bad but there support is worse. Canon should take a page out of Amazon's problem and return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Printer is great wifi is not.
customer_reviews.text: The printer itself works great. This is actually my second one. My first one died after about 3.5 years of very heavy business use. The issue I have with the unit is that wifi never works. It didn't work on my first unit and it doesn't work on this one. Oh, it does work each time you set it up and then just randomly stops until you hook it up again. Other than the wifi the printer is great. And I work right next to the machine so its not like my wifi is 4 rooms away.
customer_reviews.author: adamBomb

customer_reviews.title: Printhead (B200) error makes this printer useless
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple years. Drinks the ink but it was a good printer. Finally got the B200 error which doesn't specify any issue but after searching it appears to be an issue with the printhead. I did all the recommended options and still no luck. They are hard to find and cost more than the printer itself. So instead of repairing this one looks like we'll be getting a completely different one. TLDR: Works good for 2yrs and then has the printhead fail. Cheaper to buy a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Casteel

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE:  The WORST PRINTER WE'VE EVER OWNED!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE SEPT 2020, FEW MONTHS LATER: 1) The paper output door kept crashing down every time we printed. It FINALLY broke the extension piece so now will NOT CLOSE AT ALL! 2) The COLOR YELLOW STOPPED PRINTING. All indicators show ink full, cleaned and recleaned and deep cleaned. RESULT: "CALL FOR MAINTENANCE", which WOULD COST MORE THAN THE PRINTER! Paper input tray very cheap feeling and have to remove standard paper, expand tray, put in legal paper and then reverse back every time you want to print legal (which we do frequently). Our previous Canon MX882 worked great...UNTIL it stopped working and said "ink absorber is nearly full. CONTACT CANON SERVICE!!!!"
customer_reviews.author: Movie lover from HB

customer_reviews.title: Worst printers on the market
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit late to review this product. Better late than never. This printer is worse than the Epson if you can believe it! I printed 23 pictures with it and the ink ran out. I wanted to use it as a scanner but it will not scan without ink. Also, this printer's paper catch springs open unexpectedly. It will knock everything off one's desk that is in front of it. And it takes forever to boot up. Very little thought and effort was put into designing this printer. I guess their idea for making this printer was to sell a lot of ink.
customer_reviews.author: Compelled to write a review

customer_reviews.title: Lasted three years on very light duty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer that supposedly was for a heavier office load. After three years of very light duty, including some weeks without printing a single thing, I got the B200 error that is well documented, then it completely died. For what I paid, I expected it to last a lot longer. Very disappointed in the durability. The print quality was always good, and I think I only had one jam, but I would suspect under a heavier office load, it would not even make it to three years. I'll be trying a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: T. Shryock

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked like a dream...until it didn't. After just over a year, using it on the average scale of normal for home/self employed use, alas it has failed. First it was the ink cartridges, then the printhead, then the rollers, now an error message that won't let me past the first screen without freezing up. I've had it. Countless hours now in attempt to resuscitate this once loved printer, about another $150 in parts, and still nothing. A lot of money wasted, I now have an hp 2840 I'll be happy to report its performance here, just click the helpful button below my review and I'll update with its success or failure. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Worthless piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it lasted a few years BUT I had constant issues with it. It would disconnect the wireless where I could have to go out and reconnect it. Wasn't but a year into owning it when the scanning feature completely stopped working. Now about 2 months ago just out of the blue, the printer stopped working. Had my Best Buy remote team work on reconnecting, we got it working temporarily but stopped 2 days later. Nothing I can do fixes it. I'm in the market for a new one and you can bet your bottom dollar it will NOT be this one. Saver your $$ - don't get this one!
customer_reviews.author: nodak67

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you something about this printer. If you ever want something that will always have your back, then you need a Canon Office MX922 3 in 1 printer. This bad boy has been in the family for 6 years and it's still going strong! This thing went through the crazy years of running my own tutoring services. We would make printouts, scan multiple pages to PDF files and took a beating all these years. A few months ago, it was giving me trouble scanning to the point that I had a new printer on my cart. However, I realized there was a paper stuck after careful inspection. Don't ever doubt this machine to last you this long! lol
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Moedano

customer_reviews.title: What a nightmare!
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to set up. To start, throw the directions away--they are incomplete and confusing. Unless you are an engineer, go directly to phone support, which is good if you have a LONG time to wait. I bought this because it was Mac compatible; too bad the directions aren't Mac compatible! Now let's see if the thing stands the test of time after I blew a day just getting it to print a letter.
customer_reviews.author: Joan M. Winsor

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is the WORST printer I have ever had. It's Complicated, bulky and worst of all it doesn't stay connected to wifi. Every time it goes to sleep, it disconnects. It takes ages to set itself going to print and the scanner isn't great,super slow. Ive had it a year and gave up using it as I could do what I needed at work. Now, I need a home one so have bought an EPSON which I had before. I'd never buy canon again. Check the reviews online for the amount of issues with the wife and rubbish customer support blaming the Internet provider every time or drivers. TOTAL GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer; never had a touch screen
customer_reviews.text: This is the work horse of printers. It goes and goes and goes. When I found out it was discontinued I was not happy. Efficient printing that outdoes itself. Maybe that is why it was discontinued. Too high a quality product at too low a cost? The replacement printer (TR8520) I got from Canon for the PIXMA MX922 printer head that went bad within the 1 year warranty did not work. The replacement TR8520 is ok, but starting to reflect the same restrictions of the other printers, especially with the lack of control of the print quality (fast, draft, etc) that are starting to be the only options. Whereas the MX922 is fantastic. Will miss this printer!!!
customer_reviews.author: michele c

customer_reviews.title: Slow slow
customer_reviews.text: I have time to write a review while I wait for my printer to print my one page 20 line document. No, really it takes a long time to print most items. I am not sure why some things can print faster and some slower but it is crazy frustrating. By faster I mean 30 sec to print one page or it can be slow and take over 2 or 3 minutes while it makes all kind of noises like it is doing some kind of maintenance before printing. I would love this printer if it was not so slow.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Snider

customer_reviews.title: ) This is a really great unit. Very versatile
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased 4 to date. First one only lasted a year (cheaper to buy new than to ship 2 ways and repair fee!) 2 still being used without problems at all; and, and 1 in storage (just in case!!) This is a really great unit. Very versatile. Superb pictures. Superb copy. Super easy to set up and use. Unbelievably great software package offered by Cannon. I use to buy HP... nothing but headaches. Epson... also many problems. I am very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: art g

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the worst printer I have ever owned in my life!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned numerous printers over the years and this is BY FAR the worst! Not only is it as slow as molasses printing but it is also loud, constantly "cleans" itself and gets numerous critical errors. I bought one that lasted less than 2 years when it suddenly got an error message that required the printer be professionally serviced. I don't know if I was drunk or just stupid but during a sale, I bought a second one. It was brand new and within the first month, I was getting paper jams. They are huge, loud, slow and poor performers. I don't care if it's $5, don't buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Rita in LV

customer_reviews.title: Unresponsive Do Not Buy This
customer_reviews.text: I bought this despite the rotten reviews because I have had other canon products and they were just great. One day I went to turn it on and I discovered that it was completely unresponsive. I have unplugged it, plugged it in somewhere else, tried printing, and pressed the non-responsive on button any number of times. I have also unplugged and plugged in the power cord to the back of the unit. Nothing, nada, dead. I am not a heavy user of these machines and so my old one lasted about 5 years. This one is not expensive but it packed up after two. Most likely will not buy Canon again, pity.
customer_reviews.author: Scq2

customer_reviews.title: Slow Print Response
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 5 years ago. Today it gave me the B200 error. Page black ran empty and the printer did not tell us to change it, likely causing the B200 error. Printer was ok for most tasks. It was very slow from selection of print on the screen to actually printing something, sometimes 5 minutes would pass before the machine was ready to print, simply unacceptable, even in 2015. This alone caused me to regret this purchase from the beginning but replacement ink was cheap and it did what we needed. This will be the last Canon printer I buy as an older one also failed unexpectedly.
customer_reviews.author: GanglionCortex

customer_reviews.title: B200
customer_reviews.text: The infamous B200 error popped up randomly on a winter night in the middle of my work. You can google it and find a ton of youtube videos posted by poor fellas trying everything including washing the cartridges... It is just not worth it. These things are designed to break down after some time so you buy a new one. Most likely you guys have remaining ink like me and you will stick to the same brand. Good market strategy. Bad company...
customer_reviews.author: Muttley

customer_reviews.title: Without a doubt this has been the most frustrating, ...
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt this has been the most frustrating, worthless printer I've ever owned. You would think technology has evolved to a point where this would function normally, but instead it's an irritating mess every time we're forced to use this. The WiFi has problems connecting and staying connected, the expensive ink seems to run out faster than a half gallon of milk, and it seldom works. Sometimes it's taken as long as FIFTEEN MINUTES to start up and load a print job which is insanity if you're just sitting there waiting for it all to load. I've spent hours on with their support team and while friendly enough, nothing has resolved the issues with this hunk of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Reviews are misleading.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY this printer. I'm a huge fan of a good deal but this is not one despite the reviews. Here is why I highly suggest avoiding this unit; Low on magenta and want to simply scan a document INTO your PC (Zero printing)? YOU CAN'T DO IT........until you buy another cartridge. Want to simply SEND a fax (Zero printing)? YOU CAN'T DO IT........until you buy another cartridge. Want to simply LOOK at the Main Menu? Want to switch Wi-Fi networks? ZERO PRINTING but.... YOU CAN'T DO IT........until you buy another cartridge. Additionally - takes excessive time, is a huge (Physical) unit, expensive cartridges - seriously disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jvak4

customer_reviews.title: Apple Geek Loves it- but get the protection plan!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer so much. Color photos look fantastic. So do documents. My family is all Apple Products... macs, iPads, iPhones... and this works with Apple AirPrint. It sits in a corner of our house and we print wherever we are. ONE problem- after about 18 months the power supply went bad and nobody fixes them because repair is more $$ than a new printer (Canon support confirms this). That said, I love it enough that I'm buying the same thing again... but this time I'm spending a few bucks for the Amazon protection plan (4 year warranty). Another bummer- ink doesn't last a super long time. Get the XL cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Layna D

customer_reviews.title: Short Life Span
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 3 years, then suddenly gave a code (B200) which indicates a failed printer head, yet provides no real guidance on how to fix it. Replacing the head will cost as much as a new printer. This printer was only used occasionally and there is no excuse for this printer failing after 3 years of occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hazel

customer_reviews.title: This printer is not compatible with Chromebooks!
customer_reviews.text: I guess it was my fault for not knowing that this printer doesn't communicate with Chromebooks, but the description wasn't clear on that. There was no way to make it work with my new Chromebook, so I returned it in less than 12 hours after receiving it. I will say that Amazon was amazing in its managing the return of this large and heavy printer: I just indicated on line that I wanted to return it, clicked on the right box, and a pickup was scheduled for the next morning. I was given immediate credit for the return, and I ordered the Canon PIXMA MG 7120 which works perfectly with my chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: constant reader

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4-1/2 years and then died.
customer_reviews.text: I know, I know. Modern electronics aren't meant to last, but this is simply unacceptable. It was the classic, "It was working perfectly yesterday" and then it wouldn't turn on. I even ordered and tried replaced the power supply, no luck. So, off to the recycling plant and I will never, I repeat, never buy another Canon product given my recent experience with their LiDe 400 Scanner and this hunk of junk. It's Epson from this point forward. I might even have to try HP.
customer_reviews.author: R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Its okay. eats a lot of ink.
customer_reviews.text: if you buy non-canon ink, make sure you print often. nozzle was clogged, canon customer support was not able to help. i helped myself- replaced all ink and after several cleanings (in menu/maintenance/cleaning) and deep cleaning and alignment etc, it finally was printing again.... i changed my review from bad to acceptable, but still dont think its a good printer. however, HP is not better judging by the reviews... I did not want to spend a ton of money on a simple printer. this one is also huge - takes up lots of space. at least its wireless... non-canon ink is ~ $20 on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: sava2015

customer_reviews.title: Just died completely after two years (same time frame as what other reviewers are posting). Otherwise, four stars.
customer_reviews.text: Just died completely after two years (same time frame as what other reviewers are posting). Otherwise, four stars. Bought in 2014 for my mother. After two years of light use, it just died completely. No lights, no sounds, no nothing. If it didn't die so soon, I'd give it four stars for decent features, such as the color screen. I like how when you open the tray, the paper holder shoots out (although that broke too, but probably because someone bumped it, I assume). I'm probably just going to buy another one because my mother is used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Rated R Cars

customer_reviews.title: Slow, noisy, hard to use.  What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because my lovable old Canon printer isn't supported by Windows 7 or later. I didn't want a new printer, but I need a printer. I should have tried harder to find a good one. This printer frequently won't connect to the WiFi network, it takes many minutes to start up from being powered off, it's slow, and it's loud. The only good thing about it is that it takes individual-color ink tanks - the printer it replaced wanted one all-colors tank, and was an ink-waster as a result. I hate this printer. I'll never buy another Canon printer again.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Patterson

customer_reviews.title: I've purchased three of these.  They've all broken and are not worth fixing.
customer_reviews.text: After about a year, the "print head" breaks and the printer either won't print or prints using only some of the colors. Installing a new print head costs more than the printer. So it's a throw away. Tech said Canon isn't really a printer company but is instead an ink company, and they have figured out that many retail customers will tolerate the printers breaking down after about a year. Instead, he recommend a more commercial unit, and I went with this:  So far, I'm happy with the new printer. Seems much higher quality build and output is better and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Teichman

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: I owned this product for a couple of years and was very satisfied. When it finally quit working, I ordered the same model to replace it. This one is terrible! Color prints bear no semblance to the original file whether photo or text, the color is completely off. The B&W text is good, but if I try to copy something, the printer will insert a vertical line down the whole page. Scanning is marginal and fails frequently. I am very disappointed with this version. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Butler

customer_reviews.title: lasted 3 years with very light use
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to replace another Canon printer that died unexpectedly. Setup was easy and other than being yelled at when I'd lose power that the printer was not shut down properly, i never threw any errors. It was used VERY lightly for printing, more for scanning really, and after 3 years (almost to the day!) it died mid print. no power, no nothing. just a paperweight. When it worked, it worked fine for my needs, but I'm not going to buy another. This is my second Canon to die in some mysterious way.
customer_reviews.author: scatterbrn

customer_reviews.title: pile of garbage
customer_reviews.text: ive only had this thing for a year. - sometimes printer doesnt grab paper. u have to reinssert the paper tray. - screen's compeltely messed up. and i didnt damage it - says i need more cllour ink even though im only printing in black and white - says i need more magenta ink even though i just gave it a new cartidge and have printed hardly anything with red on it since. i got the magenta ink 10 days ago and this peice of garbage dont worjk. no magenta ink - i say print in black and white and it prints it partly in green - it won't let u do draft printing quality on the computer
customer_reviews.author: iliketrees

customer_reviews.title: Works Great after.....
customer_reviews.text: Upon first start-up, the print quality was terrible. After running thru multiple head cleanings and alignments, the print quality was still horrible. I flirted with sending it back with frustration.....and then I changed the ink cartridges, using generic cartridges from a bulk on-line dealer. The printer works as advertised now, and I can recommend it....JUST BE SURE to order extra ink cartridges (in my experience, from a cheapo bulk dealer), and be ready to throw away the snooty Canon cartridges that come with it if your initial cleaning and aligning don't work. 4 stars maybe unfair due to the amount of hassle I suffered, but it's working great now and has tons of features.
customer_reviews.author: James Nelson

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I've had three of these printers since 2012 [just bought my third one a couple months ago] - wireless feature jams between multiple users and forces power down to reset quite often - print quality is very solid, but slow. Ink is extremely cheap if you buy from off-brand on-line vendors, which is good, because this machine goes through the ink pretty quickly - overall, for one of the cheaper multi-function printers out there, I keep coming back...
customer_reviews.author: schlitz

customer_reviews.title: Works as I Expected
customer_reviews.text: We have always liked Canon products in the past. However, when our last printer bit the dust, we bought one of a different brand. Within a very few months, I was having trouble with it; and the issues just couldn't be resolved. We went back to Canon. I held off on posting the review because I wanted to see if this printer was going to hold up. We are very happy with it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Freewalt

customer_reviews.title: Still ticking after five years. I'm never buying HP again.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE, JANUARY 2020: Still working perfectly. ORIGINAL REVIEW, DECEMBER 2016: After more than a year, this printer is still working without any problems. Print quality is better than expected for the price. Ink consumption matches both the product specifications and our exceptions. Paper handling has never been an issue. Some reviewers whined about the paper trays; we say "eh". To pull out the main tray, turn your hand palm DOWN and pull it out with your fingers.Those who complained never learned the trick. This is our second Canon printer. We drove the first one into the ground. We've been pleased enough with Canon that we're never buying HP again. See my other reviews, of the previous printers we've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R. Depew

customer_reviews.title: Scanning too complicated
customer_reviews.text: I had a Canon 870 which had a very simple and easy to use scanning program that I liked. Not as good as the Epson scanning program, but still very user friendly. Canon has decided to cram all sorts of bells, whistles and barbed wire into the programs for its Series 900 printers. I wasted a lot of time scanning a document, finding it, then trying to copy it and put it into the file where I wanted it to go. When my series 900 Canon printer goes I think I will look for another brand. Too bad the overly enthusiastic lads at Canon ruined an otherwise good product.
customer_reviews.author: R Young

customer_reviews.title: Easy to change cartridges but sometimes takes forever to start printing
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with the quality of printing. I absolutely love the ease of changing ink cartridges. Occasionally and I haven't figured out the rhyme or reason yet, it cycles through it warm up routine over and over again. When this happens, it can take 2 minutes to START printing! This is unacceptable especially when I am trying to take what I was printing out the door with me. Another issue that has since been resolved, is that the driver that got installed on my computer was outdated (it had a back up CD??) and very clunky. If you get this printer, go to the Canon website and download the current driver.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen blender would make a better printer. Slow
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously inefficient. A kitchen blender would make a better printer. Slow, loud outdated - everything you're NOT looking for in a printer. I usually don't write reviews - bad or good - but thought I'd sit down and write this one while I waited on 2 pages to print. So far, we're going on 4 minutes. You'd be better off with a dot matrix on green bar. I'm using a new Mac desktop just in case you were wondering. Everything was recognized fairly well - this printer is complete crap. I will throw it away and buy a new one because I couldn't even GIVE it to a friend....they're better off writing things by hand...insane.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best Printer I have ever owned. I have a generally negative view of home printers because they never ever ever ever work when I need them to. I like things that just work. I don't have time to fidget with settings, adjust this, unjam that, unplug, replug etc. I set this printer up 3 months ago and other than changing the ink, or adding paper I haven't touched it. I print a lot for school, my wife prints a lot for school, I print some for work. It always just works. That's all I can really ask of a product. It just has to work. Good job on this one Cannon.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Marlar

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, only lasted 2 and 1/2 years with minimal use!
customer_reviews.text: This printer only lasted 2 and half years! All of my previous, really old model, printers lasted forever! I bought this printer in 2014 and it quit working a few days ago. A B200 support code showed up and I needed to call the service center. Then I was told it has had a hardware failure that I will have to either take it to a repair center and pay for the repair, or buy a new one! Very unhappy :( I will NOT recommend this printer to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy B.

customer_reviews.title: Still my favorite printer
customer_reviews.text: I had my first 922 for 6 years, bought the exact same model for mom, then replaced mine with the same model. Easy to use workhorse. Not terribly fast but doesn't blow through ink like some brands and the cartridges are all separate so you only replace the one that is out, not all 4 or 5! Sadly, this is now 2020 and the world is in chaos... and my fav printer is crying out it's death knell. B200! B200! I'm hoping I can fix it - this one is only three years old and although I really work my printers to death, I've been unemployed for nearly a year and can't afford a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Maria R

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay connected to computers.
customer_reviews.text: The printer will not stay connected to the WI FI, have to keep rebooting it ,the printer is only 6 to 8 inches away from the router. Other printers have to do a complete reconnect, then not real responsive. Very disappointed with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle S.

customer_reviews.title: Best color printer I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: The Canon MX922 is by far the best color printer I've ever had: 1. The quality of color prints is fabulous, especially on high-quality photo paper e.g. Kodak Metallic 2. The quality of black and white print is really good too 3. Unlike other printers, ink cartridges can be used until they actually run dry, and not only until the point that warning messages are displayed and the printer refuses to print 4. Scan quality is great too Down sides? Sometimes it's slow to react but that's often when my computer is tired and needs a reboot. But I use it in my home and not for commercial purposes, so at the price it's really nothing to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: look for something else
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure where to start...I don't do a lot of printing but it sucks up ink like crazy! It constantly jams and then finally it has a phantom jam and won't work at all. Only lasted three months. It refuses to take paper sizes that differ from standard. I have nothing good to say about it. OH and before I forget - the extended warranty on this is a complete pain in the ass!!! Trying to register the product is almost impossible and then trying to get it corrected - they want you to do everything for them. and in the end you are just out all the money you dumped into this stupid machine PLUS the warranty money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Cantwell

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. Unbelievable what it can do. Easy set-up, just as big as the HP all-in-one I replaced. The HP was getting old and I was having a hard time finding ink that wasn't out dated. Plus, the ink for the HP (even out dated ink) was more than the cost of this printer. Printed a couple of pictures of the grand kids and they were beautiful. The wireless portion of this printer was very easy to set up and now my wife can print from her PC on the other side of the house. I have had good luck with Canon printers so that is why I decided to get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S. Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA Printer exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. I needed a new printer to print a lot of online college course content, plus I enjoy printing an occasional photo. This printer exceeded my expectations! I now print 4x6 photos from home and the quality of the photos are great. I print often and wirelessly with no problem. My husband uses the dvd printer and I am so happy it has a feeder (our last printer did not and this was a pain). I have not used the fax because we just don't need it but I have scanned, copied and printed all wirelessly from my iPhone, and multiple computers with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: SLOW- SLOW -SLOW
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my MX960 (10 years old) with a MX922 last week. I am kind of disappointed. My old Canon printer was working OK but the new Windows 10 environment would not work with it. My old printer was quick to print text or photographs of good quality BUT the new MX960 is SLOW AS WINTER MOLASSES!! IT MAKES ALL KINDS OF SOUNDS, GRUNTS, WHIRS,CLICKS AND OTHER ASSORTING SOUNDS AND THEN It finally spits out the print very slowly. Photo quality seems OK. Sure changes my opinion of Canon printers. One would think that in 10 years there would have been an improvement?????
customer_reviews.author: napa1

customer_reviews.title: DIDN'T LAST AS LONG AS I HAD HOPED
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer Mar 1st of 2016. Now three years later I'm going to have to trash it. No matter what I do I can't get it to print color properly. I've changed out the print cartridges until I'm blue in the face. Doesn't matter what brand of cartridges I use, the results are the same. Washed out looking printing and every other kind of distorted color(s) are the only way my copies turn out. It was great for three years. I don't know what the life expectancy is for an $89 printer, but perhaps I'm asking too much.
customer_reviews.author: GLMamerow

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer for the Buck!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Realtor so having a fully functional AIO is essential. I've had Brother that lasted me years. Switched to Epson that was great, had 2 HPs that lasted me 10yrs. This Canon is amazing! The price had me thinking it was another cheap printer (I bought a HP and returned the trash printer). I highly recommend the Canon MX922. My Husband is a Computer Guy. He told me many of his clients had this printer. But, I was a HP person. After receiving the HP I bought first, I tried the Canon and it works like a champ. Does everything I need and even has silent mode. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great product for me
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this printer. I've used it to print about a hundred pictures on photo paper and scan and copy receipts and print documents and index cards and custom greeting card-all kinds of stuff. I have it set up to print in "quiet mode" after a certain time. I can print wirelessly from two different computers. Supposedly, I can print directly from my phone but I haven't quite figured that out yet. And the paper catch tray kicks out all on it's own if I print without remembering to open the tray!!! I wish it was a bit less bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: PAPERWEIGHT unless you're printing COLOR all of the time
customer_reviews.text: This printer's good if you're printing COLOR all the Time and the scanner is great for documents and photos to PDF or JPG But apparently color printers aren't worth it, if (like me) you only want to print Black on white paper Three times I've replaced the $40 (three) color cartridges because the printer has an ERROR when the color ink has evaporated and it refuses to print at all This printer has become a paper weight. If I can find the related documentation, maybe I'll sell it cheap on Amazon. For a replacement (black only printer), I'm looking at the brand BROTHER Laser Printer Monochrome Wireless
customer_reviews.author: DAVID STRONG

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work - I work from home so it gets a lot of use. Had another one - same kind - that died after 3 years. Got the same one because I can order multiple ink cartridges from independent ink sellers (not Canon or office stores) and pay about $26 for 12 cartridges (that's the same price for one from an office store). Saves me a ton on ink costs and they work just as well and last just as long. The printer also works very well - scans, faxes, copies, prints. Haven't really had any issues with it. Canon's support phone center is really good also.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa N

customer_reviews.title: AVOID THIS PRINTER!!!
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year of minimum use, the printer randomly showed an error code of B200 and said to contact the service center. I was told that it is a hardware issue and cannot be fixed. Cannon was nice enough to extend the warranty past the 1 year mark and send a refurbished printer. However if the code comes up again, we are out of luck. Printers should last more than a year....buy a simple printer.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Error Support Code 2500
customer_reviews.text: Received today and going back tomorrow. Can't get past the Support Code 2500. Consulted community threads and have been at this for 2+ hours. Some documents suggest aligning the print heads manually via the Menu screen, but you can't get to the Menu because of the error code. This code says "see manual", but the on-line manual doesn't mention the code. I completed a form on the Cannon site describing the issue, but when I hit the Submit button, nothing happened. Will not be buying another Cannon.
customer_reviews.author: Klaren

customer_reviews.title: Good copier; the second one I’ve bought. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: I paid extra for quick shipping and it arrived within 48 hours, perfectly packaged. I had the same printer before and it has been a workhorse; I do our church’s weekly program in color and it turns out a beautiful product. I haven’t compared other brands, but I di think the ink is expensive—$15 each at Walmart. And I use a lot of ink. The last one lasted me four years, making about 1000 color copies a month. I especially liked the price. This one was $89 and the last one I bought locally at Staples was $170. Same exact machine. Brand new and shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Ball

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Really great print quality. Great value. I use the duplex capability and it works really well. The automatic feeder works well also (I have had printers where this function worked poorly). Slow start up but I don't really care. Reasonable print speed but again not a factor for me. I am not a heavy user so the start up and print speed may be an issue for others. I just like a good quality printer for a few sheets a week along with excellent duplex and high DPI scanning. This printer does all of that really well.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce S

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Full Feature Color Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have several of the MX9XX models and they have held up well for me. I highly recommend these for general use. I find the photo printing to be of excellent quality if you feed quality images to the machine. They are fast with good excellent color and B/W products. I use "Blake" ink cartridges and have excellent luck with them at a great saving over Canon ink.
customer_reviews.author: Gumball

customer_reviews.title: Simple set-up
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these (one for my best friend who needed a fax machine). The set-up was a breeze ( just tell people the "WPS" button is on the back of their Wi-Fi unit) I am a computer person but didn't know that. I finally narrowed it down and found it!!! have had this unit for awhile and even though I have been printing everything I can think of I am still using the ink that came with the printer. It was cheaper to purchase this unit than the cartridges I had been buying for my old copier. this thing does it all =)
customer_reviews.author: SuzyQLou

customer_reviews.title: Awful from day one
customer_reviews.text: 1. Poor and unnecessarily complicated interface. Why even need an interface? 2. It quits printing completely if one of the ink cartridges runs out and tries to force purchase from the Canon website. 3. Even new Canon brand ink cartridges are rejected as counterfeit. 4. Ink cartridges last about 5 pages. Stinks! 5. Loses connection easily. Hard to set up now that I think about. 6. Start up and shut down take forever. 7. The poor ink management and forced purchasing on this printer approaches criminal.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila McBride

customer_reviews.title: 2 months after warranty
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd MX922 that I have purchased. It is a great printer and has a lot of usable features. I should've purchased the 2 year warranty. My printer had problems 2 months after the factory warrant ran out. The other 3 are still working fine. For the price this one was offered, I couldn't pass it up! Now it is at $207 instead of the $66 i bought it for! Lol
customer_reviews.author: LEGIN224

customer_reviews.title: Clunky, noisy.  Only lasted 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: This all-in-one printer/scanner/copier was noisy enough to make you think you were in an 19-th century manufacturing plant. It was worse at turn-on. It printed very well, for a while. After about 2 years, the alignment was off enough to be noticeable, and none of the recommended procedures were able to correct it... you'd get doubled lines on spreadsheet grid lines, for example. Photo quality went downhill. The touchscreen was complex and sometimes confusing. And it went through ink like food through an infant. After a little over 3 years, it conked out completely.
customer_reviews.author: USMN0429

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and very little use...print head fails 1403
customer_reviews.text: This will be my last Canon printer. Moving to Epson. Bought this printer 4 years ago. I really only do occasional personal printing. Used the copier to copy one sheet yesterday after which an attempt to print a page failed with 1403. I pulled the print head, cleaned it, several times to no avail. Tried to find a viable replacement at a nominal cost: Found one for $150 and it ships from China. May arrive in 2 weeks and if I have problems with it, then what? Try to find support for it on the Canon Website?!?! Forget about it!!!!!. No thank you. No more Canons!
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: " Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER. i have had two of these -- the first lasted over 3 years, then developed a fatal flaw that, according to the Canon people, would be more expensive to fix than buy a new one. I did buy a new one, because the previous one had been very reliable for a long period of time. Guess what. Less than a year after the new purchase, the printer developed the exact same "fatal flaw." Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ruffem

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not as good as MX870
customer_reviews.text: I have two MX870s and I love them. My son, my aunt, and my mother have MX922s and they seem similarly good. The MX870 has a rear feed tray with a simpler paper path for envelopes, photo paper, and other such occasional, odd-sized, or stiff media; the MX922 does not, and that's my one complaint. (Well, and that it doesn't use the same ink cartridges as the MX870, but that concern is limited to multi-printer environments like mine.) The MX922 has a second front-load paper cassette, but that seems less valuable than the rear tray unless you routinely use the *same* second media. It can directly print optical disks, but it's been years since I've burned an optical disk.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Brown

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST!! Don't waste your $$!
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked well for the first year, then it just died a slow, painful death. First the wireless function stopped working (which was one of the major reasons I bought it in the first place!), but I stuck with it. Then I kept getting error messages asking me to restart the printer, which takes about 15 minutes. Finally it just printed illegible gibberish. Everything about this printer is slow and tedious.
customer_reviews.author: PA mom

customer_reviews.title: Great so far.
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is quite good. Setup and install of initial drivers and updates went well. Photo printing seems very good on glossy 4x6 in second dedicated tray with automatic selection for that size. scanning allows you to select which (I have 3 PC's configured) to send the scan to. Seems like the ink tanks last OK but no heavy printing yet. Only the Cloud Print setup has confounded me so far. Copy function also is very good. Generally a pretty good printer for the price, and seems to be supported with current drivers, etc. Replacing a Kodak Hero 7.1 with a dead print head.
customer_reviews.author: JM SmithTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Problem is fixed by turning it off and then back on but this is ridiculous and waste ink as well
customer_reviews.text: Decent printer and the first few months no issues. Recently it's started having an error when printing stating it can not find the printer. Basically it won't connect so I can print. Problem is fixed by turning it off and then back on but this is ridiculous and waste ink as well. No one is touching the settings or messing with it otherwise so I'm not sure what the issue is. Overall, it doesn't print decently and quickly so no complaints there just the one error I keep getting.
customer_reviews.author: Cc

customer_reviews.title: Have used it for about 3 weeks now and like everything about it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Cannon printer after my huge and cumbersome Brothers printer stopped working properly. Have used it for about 3 weeks now and like everything about it. One note of caution, however, BE VERY CAREFUL OPENING THE INK CARTRIDGES. I followed instructions on how to hold and open them, but the black ink sprayed when opened and since I have my computer and printer in our guest bedroom, it sprayed black ink all over my new comforter. Next time, I'll open it over a plastic mat. Beverly Adams,Huntley
customer_reviews.author: avidreader

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: Everything you would expect from an office printer/scanner station, and more - it can scan and email you a PDF document, it can even fax. Feed it a stack of single/double sided paper, it will do the rest. Best part, it prints from last to first! Just grab your papers and staple them. It can even take photo paper and print high definition photos. This is the best printer I have ever used - This is coming from someone who has worked in big corporations where the printer/scanner stations costs THOUSANDS of dollars. MAKE SURE TO READ THE MANUAL BEFORE USING!
customer_reviews.author: Boogeyman

customer_reviews.title: Terrible printer
customer_reviews.text: Terrible printer, it broke about a week of minimal use (maybe printed 10 pages total?). When it's turned on it just hums and makes noises for 5 minutes before it's ready to print, then when I try it just displays error code 6901. UPDATE: Oh hey I wanted to update this review after owning it for 6 months! IT STILL SUCKS. Constant whirring, grinding when I turned it on. Refuses to print 95% of the time. If I cycle it on/off about 20 times I can get it to print a page. Save your time and don't buy this printer, or any Canon product because if this is a representation of what they are like then they are terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Long range review
customer_reviews.text: I've had this machine for 3 plus years. I've used the scanner and all print functions but not the FAX. It's been a great printer. Gone through countless reams of paper and photo paper. This year I had to clean the print head. Easy to do from utube video. A few glitches over the years but I was able to fix them all from the manual (on line). Great photos and clear documents. We use off brand color cartridges at a third of the price with good results. It's showing on Amazon for $75. Seems like a steal with a set of cartridges almost that much.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rice

customer_reviews.title: If you like error codes all the time, this is your printer
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a printer that is so fraught with problems. Every time I try to print something, I get some error code although I can find nothing wrong (all ink is full). I would throw the thing out the window if I didn't have so many %$&* printer cartridges. I'm going to give it one more try and if it still won't work, I will toss it, regardless of how many printer cartridges. People that say this is a great piece of technology are either getting paid or are lacking in technical knowledge. Next time I will purchase a more quality (read more expensive and durable) printer. I'm tired of these throw-aways.
customer_reviews.author: cheekymonkey

customer_reviews.title: So sad that this is unable to be repaired
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this printer. I loved it's sleek and elegant look, I loved the two-tray feature, so I could keep two sizes of paper ready at all times. Downside: Used a LOT of toner. I bought so many replacements, I could have bought a new printer several times over. BUT, the biggest sadness was when the rear paper feed broke. My repair guy told me he couldn't get parts to repair it unless I was willing to spend hundreds of dollars. I bought a later model of the same printer and it works great, but it looks cheap in comparison. oh well, I got a few good years out of it. sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It's just too bad.
customer_reviews.text: This printer should be a great product. However, despite the fact that it makes great copies and scans well, a printer should be able to print from my PC. This one doesn't. In addition customer support is non-existent. After several attempts to actually get some assistance from Canon, I am about to give up and return it.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy

customer_reviews.title: Happy 5th anniversary ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought my MX922 from Amazon on 11 September 2013. We celebrated our 5th anniversary together yesterday and I couldn't be happier. I have had no issues with this printer and use it for photos and texts on a near-daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Well Seasoned

customer_reviews.title: Won’t accept generic ink
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a year then refused the generic ink and stopped working. I really wish someone would come up with a printer that accepts generic ink - ink purchases should be a choice of the owner. So far I have owned 3 Canon printers that all did the same - quit working after using generic ink. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Works for 2 years.  2 Printers + 2 Years = 2 Dead Printers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these printers approximately 2 years ago. One for myself and one for my daughter who is in college. I print out about 100 - 200 pages a month, and my daughter prints about 50 a months. My printer had an error message after using it for about 18 months. When I called the customer service, they told me it would be cheaper to replace it than to fix it. My daughter's started flashing error messages, and I was told the same thing from the technical support. Initial Quality - Satisfied Durability - Horrible Technical Support - Equally Horrible
customer_reviews.author: Jung Y. Han

customer_reviews.title: 5 and am having a terrible time getting this printer to install
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Canon products for many years. This is the first time I've ever been so frustrated. It won't install on my Mac. I've downloaded drivers from the Canon site and still not luck. I keep getting, "The software for this printer is currently unavailable. Please contact the printer’s manufacturer for the latest software." I wanted to send them a support Email but it's a huge form and I need to go to bed. Hopefully I'll have a free hour to fill out that support form tomorrow...or call and wait on hold. I have a Mac mini with OS 10.7.5 and am having a terrible time getting this printer to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amy R

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst purchases I have ever made. Slow, when it works. Constantly needing to reconnect to the wifi, run diagnostics, remove and add printer, searching the web for advice, and so on. The best use for this printer is target practice. A printer should be plugged in, set up, and then it prints. This one does not.
customer_reviews.author: nicole reed

customer_reviews.title: Decent printer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particular model because I had a bunch of spare ink from a lower end Canon printer that took a dump. This is a solid jump in quality over the previous model I had (5500 series.) It is faster and quieter. Setup was simple and it requires less tending to. The software suite that comes with it is actually pretty decent. It's also much heavier than the 5500 series as well, I hope this means that the little gears are a bit more robust than the 5500 series.
customer_reviews.author: Overkill0084

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer in April of 2014. After several paper jams and support code B200, I re-installed the driver. This repair worked for 10 months. The printer started showing support code B200 again, and I attempted to do a clean on the thing. Now it's showing code C000. I can't even reinstall the printer like before because this new error code prohibits the printer from doing anything but beeping when I push the buttons. The wifi on the printer has gone dark, and the printer heads are all stuck on the left-hand side of the device. They cannot be moved, so it looks like I need a new printer after less than three years. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: MurphyMurphy

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for one just like it--Canon PIXMA MX922
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 PIXMA Printesr 3in 1 which I have liked. I just replaced the 2nd one when it stopped working after about 2 years so not a good life-span but I bought another just like it because I like ease of operation, good quality print AND that is has separate ink cartridges so you only replace the one that's out. It was easy to set up--if I can do it anyone can! I did have to call my computer guy to get the scanner to work--just had to remove and re-enter the Listing on PC. I can't explain further.
customer_reviews.author: J J

customer_reviews.title: Printer has major problems after only 5 days of receiving ...
customer_reviews.text: Printer has major problems after only 5 days of receiving. It will not print documents or photos. At first it received info from my computer through my router and now it will not. Worked on it for a couple of hours with zero results. Tried printing in manual mode and that doesn't work either. A piece of junk. Also there was no USB 2.0 Hi-Speed: Plug the cable into your PC for a super-fast connection for your data transfers. No USB cable to connect to printer and computer if you don't want to use wireless. Lousy product. Will contact Amazon tomorrow Dec. 19th. and ask for a refund or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Britt W

customer_reviews.title: There is no better printer PERIOD
customer_reviews.text: Why have they stopped production? We have gone through 10+ units in 8 years and there is no printer that even comes close to the stats to replace it with. We have 2 in use every day and 1 new one in waiting. All printers eventually break and that's fine - JUST LET US BUY THE SAME ONE AGAIN. We can not be without this printer.
customer_reviews.author: QB Agent

customer_reviews.title: I looked up on the website how to troubleshoot the problem I was having and it looks like it is a common defect
customer_reviews.text: This printer lasted 14 months with light use. I consider that awful. I looked up on the website how to troubleshoot the problem I was having and it looks like it is a common defect. The large black ink cartridge stopped working one day. I replaced the ink cartridge (expensive), cleaned the heads (more ink, expensive), etc. Turns out, the printer head just up and died and needs to be serviced which we all know costs more time, money and trouble than getting a new printer. This is just a home printer, so it doesn't get a ton of use. This printer was truly pathetic. I won't bother buying another Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlette_soleil

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Todays date is 11-27-17. Purchased this printer April 9, 2014. It just died, throwing a error code that I should get it repaired. In 3 1/2 years I have probably printed 500 sheets of paper, mostly in black. I have owned Canon printers through the years and have been satisfied with their performance. This printer is a failure in longevity and performance.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT F. WILSON

customer_reviews.title: Most unreliable and loud
customer_reviews.text: This printer, once it pulled its head out from it's wherever and finally printed something, had nice print quality. From beginning to end, it took about six minutes to print one page because it would spend the first five minutes and 30 seconds clunking and whirring and then it would print. My kids referred to it as "Kah-chunky the printer" because it made so much noise. It also ran through toner like it was going out of style. When it died after a year, I put it out with the e-waste collection. And it never "found" the wireless signal, though it would try and try. Poor thing...
customer_reviews.author: twelvetoes

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Until it Doesn't - Stopped working about 6 months after the 1 Year Warranty Was Up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this MX922 as a replacement for the one I had originally that failed. I already had the ink and had important documents that I needed printed ASAP so I just re-ordered the same printer and recycled the first one that only lasted about a year and half as well. I guess that's the about the life expectancy of this item. It works great up until it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Christianson

customer_reviews.title: going on 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is very good - better than prints I ordered. Slow to startup and print, but change custom settings to shorten the ink drying time, and to not use quiet mode, I think that helps. Top features for me are Airprint, fax, sheet feeder and fax. Just started using non-Canon ink (Sherman brand) - so much cheaper and print quality is just as good. Never had a problem with smudges, lines, clogs, alignment. I use the Mac image capture for scanning rather than the Canon software.
customer_reviews.author: Cheap Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer started out great, but only a couple of years after owning it it has become a gigantic paperwork due to the infamous B200 error. I looked into buying a new printhead and it costs more than buying a whole new printer. The funniest thing is that there are (convoluted, annoying) ways to get around this error and the printer works fine. So there's obviously not actually anything wrong with it except Canon thinks it's time to buy a new one. I won't be buying another Canon, guaranteed.
customer_reviews.author: sassette00

customer_reviews.title: User Friendly & Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Canon mx922. I use it for a home office and it is a work horse. It is very user friendly, great photo prints and I use the scanner daily. I can count on one hand the number of paper jams I’ve had to clear with my old Canon. Easy to set up and get printing without a lot of hassle. I had my previous printer for almost 5 years and hardly ever had an issue. I buy the compatible EZLink cartridges (Amazon) which last longer, great ink quality and are WAY cheaper than the Canons cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Morty

customer_reviews.title: SLOW - NOISY - SCANNING SOFTWARE IS HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: It's a "just okay" printer. VERY slow to activate when asked to print and plus is extremely noisy. However the thing that really irritates me is the scanning software. It is horrible! Tried to scan an item last night and the scanner took 3 minutes to warm up! Then after waiting what seemed like an eternity, it gave me an error message. I have never seen such a clunky and error prone scanner interface. My old Canon had a great scanner interface, don't have a clue why it isn't available for this machine!!
customer_reviews.author: Jon P. Kretzschmar

customer_reviews.title: A good all in one that won't kill your bank account with ink costs.
customer_reviews.text: I found both photo printing and paper printing to be of good quality. The accompanying software is a load but allows you to scan directly into Acrobat Pro or Photoshop. It's an all in one and it's functionality is on par. What makes this a 5 star review for me is the ink. It doesn't drink it and a bargain compared to HP.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Snackbar

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for years now and I could say nothing but good. Great print quality, sharp, clear. If you use original Canon cartridge and good quality photo paper the images you print is beyond imagination. True professional quality. When you use after market cartridges (like I do most of the times) the print quality is still very good but they run out uch quicker (éike 4x quicker). It has scanner opion that's also excellent. Setup is easy, software support is very good.
customer_reviews.author: ipm

customer_reviews.title: Good printer that uses aftermarket cartridges
customer_reviews.text: This is my second MX922 printer, the first one lasted about two years but that is with a lot of use in my office, printing thousands of price lists, order forms, and a few photos. I like the fact that this uses inexpensive aftermarket cartridges that you can buy for a fraction of the cost of the OEM, I just purchased three complete sets for it for under $17. Love it. The print quality is very good, and it rarely needs a head cleaning. I am not so fond of the paper trays, I would rather have a baack feading printer, and that is why I have it a four star, but all in all I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: royphotog

customer_reviews.title: wireless capabilities do not work consistently
customer_reviews.text: I bought it long time ago and barely use it. This is what makes this so disappointing. it takes ages to setup and every time I use it I have to add the wireless network over and over again. I just did it yesterday, printed a page and I am doing it again. Its ridiculous that it does not performed as promised. I am looking for a network, and I know is connected and can't find it. Then I have to do advanced setup and put the password all over again. For scanning is no differtent.
customer_reviews.author: Listener

customer_reviews.title: I had Cannon Printers all my life I loved them. Till this one.
customer_reviews.text: I will never purchase another Cannon printer! Nothing but problems. The prints not the same stripes ever time you want to print a photo. You have to contsantly clean the print head and that realy wasts ink. Plus its not user frendly. You try to print over wifi and it says and error acurded. So you have to shut your PC of and the printer to be able to print. Most times it remembers the error and you have to keep doing the same thing over and over again $200.00 piece of scrap. I will never purchase another Cannon Printer.
customer_reviews.author: Earl R Howard

product_meta.title: Canon Office and Business MX922 All-In-One Printer, Wireless and mobile printing
product_meta.description:
Style:All in One PrinterThe Canon Pixma MX922 Energy Star Wireless Inkjet Office All in One Printer prints in black and white at 15 ipm, in color at 10 ipm, and can output a borderless 4.0 x 6.0 inch photo in 21 seconds. Print borderless photos right at home using the 9600 x 2400 color dpi. Use the automatic double sided print feature to print on both sides of the page and cut your paper consumption by as much as 50 percent. The built in disc tray lets you design and print your own custom CDs, DVDs, and Blu rays. Its Full HD Movie Print feature takes a frame from an HD movie recorded on a compatible EOS, PowerShot, or VIXIA camera or camcorder and prints it as a photo, ensuring you never miss a photo opportunity while shooting video. The MX922 features a scan resolution of up to 2400 x 4800 dpi optical. Plus use the built in copy function to duplicate photos as well as documents.

SET CONTAINS:
PIXMA MX922 Wireless Inkjet Office All-In-One
CD/DVD Printing Tray
Manuals and other documents
Matte Photo Paper (For Automatic Print Head Alignment)
Setup CD-ROM
Setup Ink Tanks
Power Cord
Telephone Line Cable
feature_bullets: Features: Wireless LAN, AirPrint, Google Cloud Print, Wireless, Printing, Mobile Device Printing, USB 2.0 Hi Speed: Plug the cable into your PC for a super fast connection for your data transfers
Fully-Integrated, 35-sheet Duplex Auto Document Feeder: Easily copy, scan and fax multiple documents without having to load them one page at a time
Built-In Auto Duplex Printing: Automatically print on both sides of the page without the hassle of turning it over manually
Compatible with Individual/Combo CLI-251 XL Ink Tanks (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black) & PGI-250 XL Or PGI-255 XXL Pigment Black Ink Tanks.
20-Foot cord.OS Compatibility:Windows 8, Windows RT, Windows 7, Windows 7 SP1, Windows Vista SP1, Vista SP2, Windows XP SP3 32-bit and Mac OSX 10.6.8 - 10.9.x
Dimension (W x D x H) : 19.4 (W) x 15.6 (D) x 9.1 (H). Weight : 25.7 pounds
